sleep_index.title: Your Sleep Index trend over the last 3 weeks
sleep_index.description: The sleep index is designed to be one single metric you need to judge your sleep health, using several contributors like total sleep duration, resting HR, restfulness.

insights.description: Your overall sleep index has improved compared to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Restfulness
best_contributors.description: Restfulness is measured on the basis of your movement and awake windows during sleep.

best_contributors.title: Total Sleep
best_contributors.description: It represents the volume of uninterrupted sleep every night for your body.

best_contributors.title: Timing
best_contributors.description: This represents the adherence to your Circadian Rhythm.

worst_contributors.title: HR Drop
worst_contributors.description: HR Drop is a measure of how soon your body is able to get in to a state of rest and recovery.

insights.title: How to improve HR Drop?
insights.description: You can make your HR drop early during sleep by avoiding stimulants and physical exercise in the later half of the day.  Winding down closer to your sleep hours is a good practice and will help improve the probability of your HR dropping early.

worst_contributors.title: HRV Form
worst_contributors.description: This metric represents the HRV trend across the duration of your sleep.

insights.title: How to improve HRV Form?
insights.description: Downtrending HRV beyond normal thresholds could happen due to lack of recovery or illness. Prioritize rest and low intensity exercise to improve this.

worst_contributors.title: Temperature Deviation
worst_contributors.description: Your core temperature drops by a degree or two as just before and during sleep. And a few hours before you wake up again, it starts to rise. This is a measure of that deviation

insights.title: How to improve Temperature control?
insights.description: Lack of rest, illness or inflammation could lead to temperature elevation. Do brisk walks and prioritise rest when you see elevated temperatures.

recovery_index.title: Your Recovery Index trend over the last 3 weeks
recovery_index.description: The Recovery Score indicates your overall state of 'well-being'. It depends on markers like resting heart rate, hrv, temperature, sleep quality, movement and recovery.

insights.description: Your overall recovery index has gone down compared to the previous week. Checkout which contributors to fix and how to improve them.

best_contributors.title: Sleep Quotient
best_contributors.description: Sleep quality and duration are factored into this metric.

worst_contributors.title: Resting Heart Rate
worst_contributors.description: Put simply, the more efficient your heart becomes, the lower your resting heart rate gets.

insights.title: How to improve Resting Heart Rate?
insights.description: Sleep quality plays a major role in improving heart efficiency. On days you arenâ€™t able to get quality sleep, try a 30 min Non-sleep deep rest protocol to improve restfulness and heart efficiency.

worst_contributors.title: HRV Form
worst_contributors.description: This metric represents your HRV patterns and deviations which are indicators of your body's adaptability.

insights.title: How to improve HRV Form?
insights.description: Optimising your sleep environment will improve your HRV Form by improving restfulness and increasing the deep sleep segment of your sleep. Try hacks like warm shower, breathing exercises and avoiding blue light before sleep to find your ideal sleep environment.

worst_contributors.title: Movement Index
worst_contributors.description: This represents your overall movement trends.

insights.title: How to improve Movement Index?
insights.description: Moving for 4 mins and stretching for 1 min every hour is a simple yet extremely effective way to ensure better posture, circulation and energy expenditure.

movement_index.title: Your Movement Index trend over the last 3 weeks
movement_index.description: The Movement Index is designed to keep you moving for optimal glucose metabolism and increase your non-exercise energy usage. Its a measure of how active you were that day.

insights.description: Your overall movement index has gone down compared to the previous week. Checkout which contributors to fix and how to improve them.

best_contributors.title: Workout Frequency
best_contributors.description: This metric counts the number of days you were really active and the number of workouts you did to add in a more long term measure of your activity.

worst_contributors.title: Active Hours
worst_contributors.description: The is a measure of how active you stay at least once per hour for more hours of the day.

insights.title: How to improve Active Hours?
insights.description: Try moving for at least 10 mins every hour. While the volume of movement does matter, moving more frequently helps improve posture and blood circulation.

worst_contributors.title: Steps
worst_contributors.description: This represents the number of steps you've taken and how you're comparing to what's expected based on your routine.

insights.title: How to improve Steps Score?
insights.description: Getting most of your steps at the beginning of the day is a great way to increase your chances of hitting your steps goal.
